Class Utils

java.lang.Object
mastermind.Utils
public class Utils extends Object
Utility class for game-related functionalities such as scene loading, color mapping, leaderboard updates, and game state management.

  • Method Details

    • loadScene

      public static <T> T loadScene(javafx.event.ActionEvent event, String fxmlPath) throws IOException
      Loads a new scene (FXML file) into the current window.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the controller.
      Parameters:
      event - The event that triggered the scene load.
      fxmlPath - The path to the FXML file to load.
      Returns:
      The controller of the loaded scene.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an issue loading the FXML file.

    • getGUIColor

      public static javafx.scene.paint.Color getGUIColor(Code.Color color)
      Maps a game's color to a corresponding JavaFX color.
      Parameters:
      color - The game's color to map.
      Returns:
      The corresponding JavaFX color.

    • updateLeaderBoard

      public static void updateLeaderBoard(String username, String level, int attempts, long timeInMillis)
      Updates the leaderboard file with the latest game result.
      Parameters:
      username - The player's username.
      level - The difficulty level of the game.
      attempts - The number of attempts made by the player.
      timeInMillis - The time taken for the game in milliseconds.

    • hasUnfinishedGame

      public static boolean hasUnfinishedGame(String username) throws IOException
      Checks if the user has an unfinished game.
      Parameters:
      username - The player's username.
      Returns:
      True if the user has an unfinished game, otherwise false.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an issue reading the game state file.

    • saveToFile

      public static void saveToFile(String username, String mode, String level, Code code) throws IOException
      Saves the initial game state (mode, level, and code) to a file for a given user.
      Parameters:
      username - The player's username.
      mode - The mode of the game.
      level - The difficulty level of the game.
      code - The initial code for the game.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an issue writing to the file.

    • saveToFile

      public static void saveToFile(String username, String mode, String level) throws IOException
      Saves the mode and level of a game to a file for a given user.
      Parameters:
      username - The player's username.
      mode - The mode of the game.
      level - The difficulty level of the game.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an issue writing to the file.

    • saveGuessGameState

      public static void saveGuessGameState(String username, int row, List<String> guesses, List<String> responses) throws IOException
      Saves the state of the game (guesses and responses) for a given user.
      Parameters:
      username - The player's username.
      row - The current row of the game.
      guesses - The list of guesses made by the player.
      responses - The list of responses corresponding to each guess.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an issue writing to the file.

    • saveCreateGameState

      public static void saveCreateGameState(String username, int row, List<String> guesses, List<String> responses) throws IOException
      Saves the state of a create game (guesses and responses) for a given user.
      Parameters:
      username - The player's username.
      row - The current row of the game.
      guesses - The list of guesses made by the player.
      responses - The list of responses corresponding to each guess.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an issue writing to the file.

    • saveInitialGuess

      public static void saveInitialGuess(String username, String initialGuess) throws IOException
      Saves the initial guess to a user's game state.
      Parameters:
      username - The player's username.
      initialGuess - The initial guess for the game.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an issue writing to the file.

    • saveNextGuess

      public static void saveNextGuess(String username, String guess) throws IOException
      Saves the next guess to a user's game state.
      Parameters:
      username - The player's username.
      guess - The next guess for the game.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an issue writing to the file.

    • deleteGameState

      public static void deleteGameState(String username) throws IOException
      Deletes a user's game state file.
      Parameters:
      username - The player's username.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an issue deleting the file.

    • loadGameState

      public static String[] loadGameState(String username) throws IOException
      Loads a user's game state from the file.
      Parameters:
      username - The player's username.
      Returns:
      An array containing the mode, level, and code from the game state.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an issue reading the file.

    • loadCreateGuessesAndResponses

      public static List<javafx.util.Pair<String,String>> loadCreateGuessesAndResponses(String username)
      Loads a list of guesses and responses for a create game.
      Parameters:
      username - The player's username.
      Returns:
      A list of pairs where each pair contains a guess and its corresponding response.

    • loadGuessGuessesAndResponses

      public static List<javafx.util.Pair<String,String>> loadGuessGuessesAndResponses(String username)
      Loads the guesses and responses from a file for a given username. The file is expected to contain the mode, secret code, and the list of guesses with corresponding responses.
      Parameters:
      username - The player's username.
      Returns:
      A list of pairs, where each pair contains a guess and its corresponding response (black and white pegs).

    • formatTime

      public static String formatTime(long timeTaken)
      Formats a time value in milliseconds into a string of the format "minutes:seconds".
      Parameters:
      timeTaken - The time taken, in milliseconds.
      Returns:
      A formatted string representing the time in "minutes:seconds" format.

    • countResponsePegs

      public static javafx.util.Pair<Integer,Integer> countResponsePegs(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane responseGrid, int currentResponseRow)
      Counts the number of black and white response pegs in the response grid for a given response row.
      Parameters:
      responseGrid - The GridPane containing the response pegs.
      currentResponseRow - The row where the current response is located.
      Returns:
      A Pair containing the number of black and white pegs in the response.

    • digitsFromBase

      public static ArrayList<Integer> digitsFromBase(int number, int base, int arrLength)
      Converts a number to an array of digits in a specified base. The resulting array will have a fixed length, padding with zeros if necessary.
      Parameters:
      number - The number to be converted.
      base - The base to which the number should be converted.
      arrLength - The length of the resulting array of digits.
      Returns:
      A list of digits representing the number in the specified base.

    • verifyUserResponses

      public static List<Integer> verifyUserResponses(Code userCode, List<Code> computerGuesses, List<javafx.util.Pair<Integer,Integer>> userResponses)
      Verifies the responses provided by the user against the expected responses from the computer's guesses.
      Parameters:
      userCode - The code that the user is trying to guess.
      computerGuesses - A list of guesses made by the computer.
      userResponses - A list of the user's responses to the computer's guesses.
      Returns:
      A list of row numbers where the user's responses do not match the expected responses.

    • calculateResponse

      public static javafx.util.Pair<Integer,Integer> calculateResponse(Code code, Code guess)
      Calculates the response for a given guess based on the correct code. The response consists of black pegs (correct color in the correct position) and white pegs (correct color in the wrong position).
      Parameters:
      code - The correct code.
      guess - The guessed code.
      Returns:
      A Pair containing the number of black and white pegs.
